subject: Psychology
title: The Global Sleep Crisis
description: One-minute skill: The Global Sleep Crisis.

hook.text: Two-thirds of adults in developed nations fail to get eight hours. We are in the midst of a global sleep epidemic.

buildup.text: Modern society treats sleep as expendable â€” something to sacrifice for productivity, entertainment, or ambition.

discovery.text: The WHO has declared sleep deprivation a public health epidemic. Drowsy driving causes more accidents than alcohol.

twist.text: Cultures that sleep less don't produce more. They produce sicker, less creative, and less productive populations.

climax.text: Sleep is not a luxury or a weakness. It is a biological necessity that modern life has systematically undermined.

punchline.text: We built a world that runs 24/7. Our brains still need 8 hours.

quiz.question: What has the WHO declared about sleep deprivation?
options: It is a public health epidemic in developed nations
It is a minor inconvenience with no health impact
It only affects people over age 65
